subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's support of JUnit
msgSnippet: Integrating Ant and Junit is detailed here: http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-ant/?dwzone=java Happy integrating. Rob Michael Silverstein
messageBody:
Integrating Ant and Junit is detailed here:

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-ant/?dwzone=java

Happy integrating.

Rob




"Michael Silverstein" <msilverstein@...> on 08/03/2001 14:59:02

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com



To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
cc:
Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's
support of JUnit


That's a good question. I've just recently learned of Ant (through this
forum) and have added that very topic to my list of things to look in to. I
imagine a command line interface would be a prerequisite for being able to
batch actions other than executing tests, which I believe you would get for
free.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Hugo Garcia [mailto:elhugonyc@...]
> Sent: Thursday, March 08, 2001 8:44 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's
> support of JUnit
>
>
>
> Would it be possible to integrate this tool with Ant?
>
> -H
>
> --- Michael Silverstein <msilverstein@...> wrote:
> > It depends. The tests are stand-alone Java classes, so you can
> execute them
> > as part of your build. If you want the code coverage, the JPDA setup is
> > currently managed from the GUI, but I'm sure we could make it
> command-line
> > driven if somebody asked for it. The test generation (generate
> tests from
> > Rose design models, or class relationships) part is also driven
> from a GUI.
> > We are demand driven and very open to input, so if users
> indicated it would
> > be helpful for various aspects to be controlled from the
> command line we are
> > certainly open to adding that ability.
> >
> >
> >
> > ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
> > Mike Silverstein, Lead Architect voice: (919) 858-8300 x29
> > SilverMark, Inc. fax: (919) 858-8308
> > 5511 Capital Center Drive mobile: (919) 669-5906
> > Suite 510, Raleigh, NC 27606 toll free: (888) 588-0668
> > http://www.silvermark.com msilverstein@...
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: mrettig@... [mailto:mrettig@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, March 07, 2001 11:58 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate
> Test Mentor's
> > support of JUnit
> >
> >
> >
> > Michael Silverstein wrote:
> > >I threw together a screen capture to illustrate at:
> > >http://www.silvermark.com/evaluators/5.3result_junit.html
> >
> > Is there a command line version, or an interactive API?
> >
> > I would probably want to integrate this tool into the build
> process, so I
> > need a way to automate the testing and results. That way I can become a
> > build nazi, and notify the offending programmer every time
> he/she checks in
> > code that is not tested.
> >
> >
> > Regards,
> >
